net.sf.opensftp
Interface ProgressListener

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProgressListener, BaseProgressListener, PlainProgressListener
public interface ProgressListener
extends java.lang.Cloneable

ProgressListeners monitor progresses of put/get operations to provide progress meter functionality.

Author:
BurningXFlame@gmail.com

Field Summary
static int GET
          Represent the get operation.
static int PUT
          Represent the put operation.
 
Method Summary
 void cancel()
          Invoking this method to cancel the transfer.
 ProgressListener clone()
          Creates and returns a clean copy of this ProgressListener.
NOTE: Not to clone the operation type, the source file, the target file, the total size of the file and the current progress.
 void complete()
          Invoked when the transfer is completed.
 void init(int op, java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest, long total)
          Invoked when a new transfer is about to be initiated.
 boolean isCancelled()
          Check whether the user has cancelled the transfer.
Please refer to the description of the cancel() method for more details.
 boolean isIdle()
          Check whether this ProgressListener is idle or not.
Being idle means being ready for use.
 ProgressListener newInstance()
          Returns an instance of ProgressListener.
The algorithm is as follows:
Return this object itself if it's idle.
 void progress(long delta)
          Invoked when more data has been processed.
 void reset()
          Reset this ProgressListener.
This method should reset the operation type, the source file, the target file, the total size of the file and the current progress.
Before reusing a ProgressListener, please make sure it's completed or cancelled, and then call reset() on it.
 void setIdle(boolean idle)
          Set the status of this ProgressListener, idle or not.
Being idle means being ready for use.
NOTE: Before using a ProgressListener, call setIdle(false) first. The complete() method should call setIdle(true) at its very end. setIdle(true) should be called when the transfer is actually cancelled (not going to be cancelled).
 

Field Detail

PUT

static final int PUT
Represent the put operation.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GET

static final int GET
Represent the get operation.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

init

void init(int op,
          java.lang.String src,
          java.lang.String dest,
          long total)
Invoked when a new transfer is about to be initiated.

Parameters:
op - the operation type. Candidate values are PUT and GET.
src - the source file of the operation
dest - the target file of the operation
total - the size of the file measured with a certain unit.

progress

void progress(long delta)
Invoked when more data has been processed.

Parameters:
delta - an increment, i.e. the newly completed size, measured with the same unit with the total param of the init method.

complete

void complete()
Invoked when the transfer is completed.

cancel

void cancel()
Invoking this method to cancel the transfer.
This method, together with isCancelled(), enables you to cancel a transfer. To accomplish this function, the concrete implementation of SftpUtil should repeatedly invoke the isCancelled() method during a transfer by a certain frequency to determine whether to continue the transfer or not.
NOTE: please make cancel() and isCancelled() be a pair of synchronized methods.

isCancelled

boolean isCancelled()
Check whether the user has cancelled the transfer.
Please refer to the description of the cancel() method for more details.

Returns:
true if the transfer has been cancelled; false otherwise.

setIdle

void setIdle(boolean idle)
Set the status of this ProgressListener, idle or not.
Being idle means being ready for use.
NOTE:
  • Before using a ProgressListener, call setIdle(false) first.
  • The complete() method should call setIdle(true) at its very end.
  • setIdle(true) should be called when the transfer is actually cancelled (not going to be cancelled).

isIdle

boolean isIdle()
Check whether this ProgressListener is idle or not.
Being idle means being ready for use.

Returns:
true if this ProgressListener is idle; false otherwise.

reset

void reset()
Reset this ProgressListener.
This method should reset the operation type, the source file, the target file, the total size of the file and the current progress.
Before reusing a ProgressListener, please make sure it's completed or cancelled, and then call reset() on it.

clone

ProgressListener clone()
Creates and returns a clean copy of this ProgressListener.
NOTE: Not to clone the operation type, the source file, the target file, the total size of the file and the current progress. Conversely, reset them.

Returns:
a clean copy

newInstance

ProgressListener newInstance()
Returns an instance of ProgressListener.
The algorithm is as follows:
  • Return this object itself if it's idle. Reset it before return.
  • Return a clean clone of this object.
To make this method work, make sure implement the following methods correctly:
isIdle(), setIdle(boolean), reset(), clone().
And make sure setIdle() is called where it should be.

Returns:
a clean instance
See Also:
isIdle(), setIdle(boolean), reset(), clone()
